title: Argentine Diplomat Set to Lead U.N.’s Atomic Agency
text:
Argentine diplomat Rafael Grossi is set to become the new head of the United Nations’ atomic agency, after winning backing from the board Tuesday following a tight race in which he pledged to shake up the body and get tougher on Iran’s nuclear effort.

Mr. Grossi, who diplomats said was strongly backed by the U.S., will be formally elected if he receives the backing of the International Atomic Energy Agency’s full membership. That is expected to happen in the next few weeks, but no date has been set.

...
description: Argentine diplomat Rafael Grossi is set to become the new head of the United Nations’ atomic agency, following a tight race in which he pledged to get tougher on Iran’s nuclear effort.
